lead_paragraph: The performance ignited accusations that officials connived in rekindling Cultural Revolution-era veneration of Mao right before the 50th anniversary of the start of that traumatic era.

byline.contributor: Yufan Huang and Vanessa Piao contributed research.

headline.print_headline: Some in China See Trouble in a Musical Tribute to Mao
headline.main: After Maoist Music and Slogan, Harsh Light Shines on Chinese Show

snippet: The performance ignited accusations that officials connived in rekindling Cultural Revolution-era veneration of Mao right before the 50th anniversary of the start of that traumatic era.
abstract: Performance by all-female Chinese pop group 56 Flowers spurs clash between political liberals and neo-Maoists because of its homages to Cultural Revolution, dark decade in Chinese history that Communist Party has since distanced itself from.
